subject: Mental Health
title: Poverty and Child Mental Health
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Poverty and Child Mental Health.

hook.text: Children in poverty are 3 times more likely to have a mental health disorder.

buildup.text: Chronic stress from food insecurity, housing instability, and violence floods developing brains.

discovery.text: Poverty literally shrinks the hippocampus and prefrontal cortex in developing children.

twist.text: Direct cash transfers to poor families improve children's brain development measurably.

climax.text: Addressing poverty is one of the most effective mental health interventions for children.

punchline.text: You can't therapize away hunger, danger, and instability.

quiz.question: How does poverty affect the developing brain?
options: It shrinks the hippocampus and prefrontal cortex
It has no effect on brain development
